Isobutane.Description: Isobutane is an isomer of butane, meaning they have the same chemical formula but different structural arrangements.
Isobutane and propane are both alkane hydrocarbons, commonly used as fuels.
Isobutane and methane are both hydrocarbon compounds, but isobutane has a higher molecular weight and boiling point.
